alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... Yet Glass states: 'The two Pioneer Venus probes that descended on the right side of the planet detected a faint steady glow beginning about 12 - 15 km [7.5 - 9.5 miles] altitude that increased in intensity near the surface.' [323]

[322] Kopal, Realm of the Terrestrial Planets, op. cit. p184.

[323] Glass, Introduction to Planetary Geology, op. cit., p374.
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Venus' Ashen Light - Part 4
